wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Andrews FRSE FRS FCE ICE (16 February 1847 – 19 June 1907) was an English metallurgical chemist and ironmaster.

response: Thomas Andrews (1873–1912) was the shipbuilder of the RMS Titanic.
*Thomas Andrews (MP for Dover) (born before 1540), English politician
*Thomas Andrews (politician) (born 1953), American politician from Maine; non-profit executive; and United Nations Special Rapporteur on the Myanmar human rights situation
*Thomas Andrews (metallurgist) (1811–1871), British metallurgist of international renown
*Thomas Andrews (ironmaster) (1847–1907), English ironmaker and Fellow of the Royal Society
Thomas Andrews (30 June 1811 – 19 June 1871) was a British metallurgist of international renown.

After his death in 1871 his son Thomas Andrews (1847–1907)Geoffrey Tweedale, "Andrews, Thomas (1847–1907)", Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004 accessed 12 Nov 2011 took an active part in running the forges.
